attributes.action: Allow Bashir Ahmadzai to stay in the UK indefinitely.
attributes.background: Bashir Ahmadzai came to the UK 6 years ago to escape the Taliban. He is profoundly deaf & court documents say he has “complex speech, language & communication difficulties”.  He is an extremely vulnerable young person who is under threat of deportation. We ask that he is allowed to remain in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: For more information please read this comprehensive piece about Bashir's case by Aditya Chakrabortty which appeared in the Guardian on 26 June: https://amp.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jun/26/trump-british-brutality-us-mexico-border

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to have compulsory logo trousers, skirts or shirts
attributes.background: Many schools and academies are adding expensive logo trousers, skirts and shirts to their uniforms, for example increasing the cost of school trousers from £4.50 to £19.95. Often the opinions of parents are ignored, and families have to pay these large bills or face having their children excluded.
attributes.additional_details: If you wish to see evidence of this, look at the cost of uniform providers such as Just Schoolwear or Schoolwear Solutions for logo items. Then compare to a high street retailer such as George, Tesco or Sainsbury.

attributes.action: Make Alcoholic Drinks Carry A Health Warning.
attributes.background: I believe that Alcoholic Drinks should carry a Health Warning on the label, as Cigarettes do. These Health Warnings should include things such as: the possibility liver failure and other health issues that Alcohol consumption can cause, as well as carry a general warning to Not Drink and Drive.

attributes.action: All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future.
attributes.background: The recent BREXIT referendum limited the right of UK citizens to vote on the UK's future on the basis of residence. UK citizens, resident abroad, but still registered in electoral roles, were eligible. However, many others were disenfranchised and unable to vote on issues affecting their future.
attributes.additional_details: UK citizens, working and living in the EU for more than 2 years before the Brexit referendum, were arbitrarily disenfranchised  by the UK Government, and were ineligible to vote on an issue that affected their future and legal standing in the EU. Parliament must ensure that any future referendum affecting the governance of the UK must consult all UK citizens, regardless of residence. Local Consular offices charged with registering all UK citizens abroad, can verify their voting eligibility.

attributes.action: Bring Oliver Robbins before the European Scrutiny Committee.
attributes.background: Mr Robbins has a key role in the negotiations for exiting the EU. He is a public servant and as such is answerable for actions that he has taken.
attributes.additional_details: In PMQs on 2nd May 2018, the Chair of the ESC asked the Prime Minister to request the presence of Ollie Robbins to answer questions for the Committee. He commented that Mr Robbins has been asked at least 3 times. It is unacceptable, when he is so involved in the negotiations, that he has shown such disregard to the Committee and the electorate.

attributes.action: Introduce statutory LGBT+ element for Initial Teacher & School Governor Training
attributes.background: A lack of training on the prevention of LGBT+ bullying, means providers like Stonewall & www.inclusionforall.co.uk often work with schools where LGBT+ bullying is already happening. Stonewall research shows almost half of LGBT pupils are bullied at school. Teachers must be trained from the start.
attributes.additional_details: The National LGBT Survey found that a third of respondents who were in education in 2016-2017 said that they experienced a negative reaction during that time due to them being, or people perceiving them to be, LGBT. The most frequent perpetrators of the respondents’ most serious incidents were other students (in 88% of cases) but a tenth (9%) were committed by teaching staff. The resulting action plan focuses heavily on ‘tackling’ not organisational culture change in order to prevent prejudice.

attributes.action: Introduce Emergency Visitor Visa for families of citizens with critical illness
attributes.background: My friend was diagnosed with cancer recently. Chemo makes her so sick that she struggles to take care of her 2 year daughter. Her mother applied for UK visitor visa to come and look after her and her family. However it was rejected saying she is not a genuine visitor and will not go back to Iran.
attributes.additional_details: A new visitor visa category should be introduced  for non-British immediate family members of British citizens with life threatening illnesses such as cancer or conditions requiring full-time care. This is to assist British citizens with family living outside of the UK in receiving the mental and physical support of their families, paramount to coping with their health issues and difficulties arising from their condition.

attributes.action: Ban the use of face coverings at protests and counter protests.
attributes.background: It has became common practice for protesters to attend protests with their faces totally covered. With the sole aim of causing trouble and escaping police prosecutions. The police rely heavily on video footage to enable prosecutions at later dates and away from a hostile crowd.
attributes.additional_details:
Being able to cover ones face empowers people to commit crimes of assault, criminal damage, racial abuse, etc, that they may not otherwise commit. Much the same as a fake profile online empowers people to say things that they would be to afraid to say on a real profile. 
A law would greatly aid the police in doing their job and keeping the peace at public protests and counter protests. I feel it would reduce the number of offences committed at protests considerably.

attributes.action: Vehicle theory test to include section on motorcycle awareness on the road
attributes.background: Please help change our vehical theory test in scotland! To include a mandatory section on how drivers and motorcycle riders can look out for each other on the road. So we can prevent a very high amount of Accidents regarding road users.
attributes.additional_details: 20% of all accidents on Scotland's non-build up roads involve motorbikes. Approximately 60% of all motorcycle fatlities in scotland occur on these carriageways. In 2017 their were 827 motorcycle accidents 34 were fatal. Not a single cause of motorbike accidents in 2017 were caused by flooded/icy road coditions. 50% of motorbike accidents in Scotland were 30mph or less! Riders are 40 times more likely to be KILLED than any other road user. We can change this! Please sign this petition.

attributes.action: We want Britain to give more help and treatment for people with a Pineal Cyst
attributes.background: Sadly Great Britain does not acknowledge symptomatic Pineal Cysts as other countries do. This leaves sufferers with awful symptoms and no offer of the much needed surgery to help them. This needs to change to allow sufferers to live their lives free from pain.
attributes.additional_details:
Some common symptoms of a pineal cyst can be
* Constant headaches
* vomiting and nausea
* weakness and loss of feeling in one side
* abnormal eye movement and blurriness in vision
* changes in memory and personality
* changes in speech
* drowsiness and seizures
* increased anxiety
* constant fatigue
Other countries offer surgery to remove the cyst but we want more help and support in this country so people don't have to go abroad for help at the cost of tens of thousands of pounds.

attributes.action: Change the colour of becons to red when stationery for recovery vehicles
attributes.background: Unfortunately the use of amber becons do not work any more everything these days seems to have amber lights the recovery industry have lost a lot of people lately doing our job at road side
attributes.additional_details: The construction industry have got green becons when working it makes them stands out we would stand out with red becons and it could save our lives

attributes.action: End the 'hostile environment' for immigration & revoke the 2014 immigration act
attributes.background: The 2014 bill the bill makes it as inconvenient and unpleasant as possible to live in Britain without documents by privatising the process of checking status to people in civil society.
attributes.additional_details: This has directly led to the Windrush debacle and quite rightly lots of opprobrium and calls for 'amnesty' for Windrush generation. However the immigration act 2014 is causing issues for all people who have immigrated here and should be revoked.

attributes.action: Bring in and legalise hand signals for riders to ask drivers to slow and stop
attributes.background: Horse riders are confronted with drivers driving too close and too fast causing many accidents to horses and riders, even death, with no convictions. Drivers need to be accountable for their actions, we need to be able to legally ask drivers to slow and stop to keep us safe.
attributes.additional_details: Horses are being left dead on the roads because drivers do not allow down or pass wide, resulting in injured or dead horses with rider injury, no driver can be prosecuted for hitting a horse the only way is for the rider to be admitted to hospital, this is wrong. We see over the hedges, we know if our horse might spook so sometimes we need drivers to stop and give us a few seconds. At the moment legally drivers do not have to abide our signals, we are on a living, sometimes unpredictable, animal.

attributes.action: Provide and fund research into incurable PCOS and HS including the link between
attributes.background: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and Hidradenitis Suppurativa are common incurable illnesses that are dismissed due to the lack of understanding about why they occur and why the two are often found to occur together. The coping strategies fail many people or cause further illnesses as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Antibiotics are often used as treatment for HS but this is not good enough when we are under threat of antibiotic resistance.
The pill is used as treatment for PCOS but doesn't seem logical when many women struggle to conceive a child anyway.
Despite being made to try a range of prescription medicines and treatments that may not help at all, we are not exempt from paying for them.

attributes.action: Grant immunity from prosecution for military, whilst on Govt Duty.
attributes.background: A statutory time limit of 5 years to be applied and back-dated in regards to the rights of people to bring prosecutions for alleged offences committed by members of the British Military taking part in Govt Sanctioned Operations. After this period, the military should be exempt from prosecution.

attributes.action: Give all UK residents the right to vote in local government elections
attributes.background: There should be a change in electoral law to ensure that everyone who is permanently resident in the UK and of voting age has the right to vote in local government elections.
attributes.additional_details: For those who live in a local community, numerous aspects of their daily life – such as housing, education, local amenities, public transport, cultural and sports facilities – are influenced by decisions taken by the local authority. It is therefore only fair to extend the right to vote and be elected in local elections to all long-term UK residents, regardless of their citizenship. Such a move would also ensure that EU citizens retain their right to vote in local elections after Brexit.

attributes.action: Create an independent body that holds the PHSO to account
attributes.background: The Parliamentary and Health Service Ombudsman investigates serious complaints against the NHS. I made a complaint about my son Cody's death, which I believe was caused by failures in his care in hospital. But they didn't uphold my complaint, and there's no way for me to appeal their decision.
attributes.additional_details: There should be an independent body that checks whether the PHSO has done a proper investigation and considered all the evidence. This should be overseen by the Secretary of State for Health, so that there is democratic accountability. An independent investigation would give people reassurance and could help them get to the truth about what happened to their loved ones.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on USA for removing children from immigrant parents at borders
attributes.background: America is currently removing children from their immigrant parents at borders, and placing them alone in detention centres. Its also come to light that they have since 'lost' track of over 1500 children.. the these children have simply disappeared.

attributes.action: Remove shortage occupation codes and Teaching roles from Tier 2 Visa cap.
attributes.background: Since December 2017, points required to obtain a Restricted Certificate of Sponsorship (RCOS) has more than doubled. Originally, only 21 points was required for sponsorship. Lately, the points have been set between 46-55 points.
attributes.additional_details:
Schools in the UK are facing the worst recruitment and retainment crisis. 
Removing all teaching roles from the RCOS cap will allow foreign educators to remain in the UK, ultimately helping to ease the current issues. 
Additionally, removal of the shortage occupation codes will allow businesses to more fairly compete for international talent.
http://www.bbc.com/news/education-42873153
https://www.peoplemanagement.co.uk/news/articles/businesses-unable-recruit-overseas-visa-limit-breached

attributes.action: The Saudi Arabian Ambassador should be expelled.
attributes.background: The Saudi armed forces are attacking Yemen with bad reconnaissance. The result is the large scale killing of innocent civilians. The Saudi authorities permit this situation to perpetuate.
attributes.additional_details: At least 29 children have been killed and 30 wounded in a Saudi-led coalition air strike in Yemen, the International Committee of the Red Cross says. The children were travelling on a bus that was hit at a market in Dahyan, in the northern province of Saada. The health ministry run by the rebel Houthi movement put the death toll at 43, and said 61 people were wounded. The coalition, which is backing Yemen's government in a war with the Houthis, said its actions were "legitimate".

attributes.action: Bring the deadline to eliminate plastic by 2042 forward
attributes.background: Our planet is being consumed by plastic. It is a major crisis. Plastic has taken thousands lives of sea wildlife. By 2050 there is going to be more plastic in the sea than fish. 2042 is too late for us! We're children. We can't do anything about the production of plastic but you can.
attributes.additional_details:
Your deadline is too late for our generation. Not only does plastic waste ruin our fragile, beautiful environment, it is becoming harmful to our health. Companies use plastic. They need to be more culpable for the amount of unnecessary plastic being produced. This can be enforced by the government as you can change polices to prevent this or heavily tax companies that produce excess plastic. Please consider our words.

Yours hopefully, Year 6 Sandgate Primary School
attributes.creator_name: Miss Catherine Thomas (on behalf of Year 6 at Sandgate Primary School)

attributes.action: Parking on pavements, verges or footpaths to be made an offence in England.
attributes.background: Vehicles parking on pavements, verges or footpaths invariably place pedestrians at risk by forcing them onto the road.
attributes.additional_details: Vehicles parking on pavements, verges or footpaths, – even on roads with no markings, invariably place pedestrians at risk by forcing them onto the road. This is further exacerbated for wheelchair users and parents using pushchairs etc. I feel that this is an increasingly common behaviour which will eventually result in an increasing death and injury toll. In this age of improving Health & Safety legislation this type of behaviour is a travesty.

attributes.action: Bring back Appeal rights & Right to work for migrants
attributes.background:
Under Immigration Act 2014, most migrants lost their right of appeal -that took their basic rights away - like Access to employment, NHS & much more. These are some of the basic needs a person requires to sustain one self. 
This has lead to many migrants living in destitute conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of windrush incident,many of us are now awake as to what is happening in the society we live in.The whole country was left in shock. The migrants suffer everyday with these hostile policies.

We have recently seen a case of a Nigerian woman who despite facing difficulties got justice thru the courts. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/aug/21/court-says-seriously-ill-woman-can-work-while-fighting-uk-deportation

Please help in bringing back basic needs for these migrants.

attributes.action: Introduce reduced flexible working hours for breastfeeding parents
attributes.background:
There are benefits to mother and child for extended breastfeeding with the WHO recommends breastfeeding for the first 2 years of life. 
Many women find the return to work makes continuing breastfeeding difficult, other countries have support in place for this to continue.
attributes.additional_details:
Many other countries have support in place for breastfeeding to continue, eg Portugal has a 'breastfeeding license' which reduces the working day by 2 hours, this would allow a mother the optiond to arrive later, leave earlier, pop home during the day to feed or to use the time during the working day to pump to provide milk for when they are away.

Many women need to return to work and a change like this would allow them to provide financially as well as physically for their child.

attributes.action: Cancel Parliament's Summer Recess to sort out the Brexit Deal
attributes.background:
MPs have failed to agree a plan for Brexit and are clearly now struggling to fit the debate into their schedules, given that they all expect to be leaving Westminster for their Summer Holidays shortly.
We urgently need to ensure a good deal for Britain from the EU, ahead of Brexit in March 2019.

attributes.action: Revise and implement strategies to improve the quality of life for care leavers
attributes.background:
From foster care to independence, the support care leavers receive is automatically reduced, and their voice is no longer heard. This makes it increasingly difficult for care leavers to progress into adulthood, compared to young people who grew up with their birth parents. 

This needs to change.

attributes.action: All NHS hospitals should provide vegan meals including dairy free spread & milk
attributes.background: 7% of the uk population are vegan and many have had very poor experiences of being a patient and not having any food to eat. Plant based diets are beneficial to good health and prevent many illnesses including types of cancer.

attributes.action: Conduct an urgent review of the Immigration Acts 2014 and 2016
attributes.background: I request an urgent review of the legislation in the Immigration Acts 2014 and 2016 (‘the Acts’), in view of the recent adverse publicity over the “Windrush” generation citizens of the UK and colonies, who are  reported to have suffered alleged violations of their civil liberties and human rights.
attributes.additional_details: As a consequence of the implementation of the Acts, several UK/EU citizens of the "Windrush" generation have suffered loss of:- indefinite leave to remain, employment, housing, health care, bank accounts, driving licences, freedom of movement in EU states, and have experienced detention or threats of detention, and deportation/removal from the UK.

attributes.action: Close the financial support gap for students taking a leave of absence
attributes.background: We call for the Department of Work and Pensions, in line with the policy of Student Finance England, to recognise students taking a leave of absence as no longer full-time students, and thus eligible to claim benefits including Housing Benefit, Income Support, JSA, and ESA and Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Students on a leave of absence are not considered to be full-time students by SFE, so their loan and maintenance payments stop. The DWP class these students as full-time and thus not eligible for state benefits. 

Students require leave for many reasons, such as illness, disability, bereavement, care duties, pregnancy and parental leave. Current rules place these students in a vulnerable position whereby they may have access to no support at all, pressuring them to drop out of their degrees.

attributes.action: Stop the Oxford-Cambridge Expressway & all associated ill-conceived development
attributes.background: Disastrous plans for an expressway and 1,000,000 new homes across our Home Counties cannot be allowed to happen. How can Oxfordshire absorb double the amount of houses it currently has?  Similar proposals exist for Buckinghamshire, Bedfordshire, and Cambridge.  Totally unsustainable project.
attributes.additional_details: Guardian newspaper article and other media refers - https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/aug/22/project-britain-debate-oxford-cambridge-expressway

attributes.action: Allow EU nationals with permanent residence to participate in a People's Vote
attributes.background:
The prospect of parliamentary deadlock has revived talk of a second referendum. 
The Brexiteers lied during the campaign and broke election law for deliberately exceeding spending limits and making false promises.
The public deserves a chance to vote on the final deal.
attributes.additional_details:
In light of this, EU residents in the UK have studied, worked, paid taxes and contributed to the British society for many years. Many have permanent residence but not yet British citizenship. They have made the UK their home and they deserve to have a say in the (possible) upcoming referendum. 
Kindly consider this petition.

attributes.action: To withdraw the invitation extended to Donald Trump of a state visit to the UK
attributes.background: In light of the current US administration's withdrawal from the JCPOA the appropriateness of a UK state visit must be reassessed. The actions of Donald Trump threaten both global security and to undermine global cooperation on all fronts. A state visit sends a message of solidarity not condemnation.

attributes.action: Condemn the actions of the 1970-79 Governments in taking the UK into the EEC
attributes.background: There has long been controversy as to the legality of Britain being a member of the EEC/EU. We believe that our entry into the EU was contrary to the Vienna Convention 1969 and the British Bill of Rights 1689. The Government must acknowledge this and condemn the actions of the 1970-79 Governments.
attributes.additional_details: Actions that violated the Vienna Convention could include secret negotiations, misleading the people and failing to conform with the constitution of the signature state. No Treaty is valid if people of that state are misled as to the intentions of a treaty and it is not made in "good faith". With the republication of document FCO 30/1048, we believe the 1970-79 Governments were complicit when assuring the people and UK Parliament that there was no question of surrendering national sovereignty.

attributes.action: Pressure Kingdom of Saudi Arabia not to execute a female civil right activist.
attributes.background: Israa Al-Ghomgham is an activist who participated in and documented the mass protests that have taken place in Qatif province in Saudi Arabia since 2011. She is currently facing the death penalty and is due to be beheaded by a public prosecutor of the KSA.
attributes.additional_details:
Saudi Arabia is taking the rare step of seeking the death penalty for a 29-year-old female activist accused of encouraging demonstrations for greater rights for the Shiite Muslim minority, the advocacy group Human Rights Watch said. 
Beheading Ms Israa Ghomgham for conducting peaceful protest is a barbaric act that violates both British and Universal values of basic human rights. We demand that the British Government put maximum pressure on the KSA to stop this barbaric act.

attributes.action: Incorporate LGBT+ history in primary and secondary school education
attributes.background: By introducing education of LGBT+ history, promoting LGBT+ equality and diversity and the normalisation of same-sex relationships in primary and secondary schools, we can work with children across the UK to help fight and prevent discriminating, and encouraging acceptance in future generations.

attributes.action: Stop animals being used for street entertainment in order to gain money
attributes.background:
Animals are being used by buskers to gain money should be banned!
Animals are being abused, and treated cruelly
Any animal being used for street entertainment should be jailed and dogs siezed
attributes.additional_details: Dogs have been siezed by the rspca for abuse, ill health over the past two years already 17 dogs have been siezed, some through heat exhaustion, urine infections due to not being allowed to pee in the same place, they are wacked by their leads, water bowls are for show only, they are beaten back at base and also drugged this is no life for any animal, this has to stop!!

attributes.action: Remove chargeable road tax for UK vehicles over 30 years old
attributes.background:
Currently as it stands the total value of road tax paid on my classic car since new now out-values the value of the car itself today ! and also may be higher than the original RRP of the vehicle in 1986.
I hereby request to open a petition to remove chargeable road tax on vehicles over 30 years old

attributes.action: Issue statement on the draft Directive on copyright in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: Proposal for a Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on copyright in the Digital Single Market in its current shape will severly impact the economic freedom and freedom of speech of all EU citizens if implemented. It favours big companies and research institutes over individuals.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of the devastating effects of Coercive Behaviour.
attributes.background: Victims of Coercive Behaviour are mentally, emotionally and financially abused. The Government must fund a campaign to raise awareness of the effects of coercive behaviour. Police, health care workers, lawyers and others who may meet victims of coercive behaviour also need training.
attributes.additional_details: I reported my abuser to the police, my doctor, a lawyer and nothing was done. More awareness and training is needed to protect men and women and children. They are usually too scared to make a report to the police for fear of being ridiculed. This is a major crime with devastating effects and victims need to be taken seriously. I was totally humiliated by my abuser over several years, my mental condition and self-worth was at rock bottom.

attributes.action: The House of Lords may be in need of reform, but must not be abolished.
attributes.background: Given the power structures in Britain, its electoral system, and the lack of a head of state who can exercise oversight, a unicameral parliament would be a disaster.
attributes.additional_details:
Unelected as they are, they're still an essential part of the 3 pillars of State, in holding the executive to account.

The Lords has many experts in many fields.... to be an MP or part of the executive, you need NO qualifications, even to hold one of the great offices of State.... maybe the old school tie perhaps.

Unelected they do not fall foul of the virus that is populism which is what led to the rise of fascism in the 1930's

They are thus indispensable.

attributes.action: Extend the 10-year storage limit on egg freezing
attributes.background: In the UK, the HFE Act states that all gametes can be stored for up to 10 years, but for medical egg storage and for sperm storage it can be extended to 55 years. Currently, eggs frozen for social reasons cannot be extended for more than the initial 10-year period; it is this we wish to change.
attributes.additional_details: Research examining social egg freezing have most commonly identified the lack of a suitable partner, a fear of running out of time to form the desired family, and a fear of future regret as driving women’s use of this technology (Baldwin, 2018; Baldwin et al 2018; Waldby, 2015). In order to allow women to have sufficient time to use their stored eggs to conceive the 10 year time limit needs to be removed.

attributes.action: Abolition of the coarse fishing closed season on rivers (16th March-16th June)
attributes.background: This outdated law has left us Angler’s twiddling our thumbs for years, there is no evidence to prove all year round fishing harms fish’s breeding habits, no effects have been seen on commercial fisheries and canals which have had no closed season for years.
attributes.additional_details: We have also seen the loss of Tackle & bait shops for years during the closed season as takings reduce massively, fishing seems to be a dying hobby which is a crying shame as kids and adults alike could do with more outside pastimes not less. More fishing time and longer evenings (in closed season) can give the sport and local businesses a real boost and give more opportunities for people to take up Angling.

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to ban the practice of killing dogs inhumanly
attributes.background:
Thousands of dogs are annually tortured to death during the Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, boiled to death, beaten, burned and dismembered while still alive. 

Yulin began in 2009; it is not tradition. Nor is there a valid comparison bet

attributes.action: Ban Standing Charges on all Energy and Water Bills
attributes.background:
Standing Charges on Gas, Electricity and Water, bills are an unfair charge, and have no real basis on the amount of Energy or water used.
The standing charge is just another way for the Energy and Water Companies to unjustly increase their profits.
attributes.additional_details:
SSE charge £24.53 plus 5% VAT =  £26.98 on both Gas and Electricity,
For a dual fuel set up that adds £53.98 per quarter to the consumers bill, absolutely no real justification for this type of rip off.

attributes.action: Bringing back a direct train service from London to Grimsby Return.
attributes.background:
For many years we have had to deal with the loss of business from Grimsby, the big blow was the loss of our direct connection to London via train.

I am starting this petition because I want to see the now publicly owned ECRL extend their London to Lincoln service to Grimsby or Cleethorpes.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a regular service which is run from London Kings Cross to Lincoln daily. It takes 1.55hrs from London to Lincoln. To get to Grimsby from Lincoln, it would take around an extra 20 -30mins directly. 

This would be overall a journey time of 2.30hrs - 2.40hrs from London to Grimsby. 

Grimsby is a great town and always has been. A huge amount of grimbrians have moved to london for work and have family still in Grimsby, more importantly it would bring much needed businesses to the area!

attributes.action: Increase the basic salary for NHS Dental Nurses
attributes.background: On average Dental Nurses get paid £8.29 an hour even though they have to study for 1 or more years to become qualified. Dental nurses deserve to be paid better for the level of skill and knowledge. The pay does not reflect the cost of being a dental nurse.

attributes.action: Reinstate the old train timetable for Southern, Thameslink and Southeastern rail
attributes.background: On May 20 2018 the rail industry made the biggest changes to train times in a generation.  For the first three days of the new time table the operators could not run a full service or trains on time. There is too much pressure on key stations which continually will result in delays and disruption.
attributes.additional_details: There is countless news stories regarding this and the only option to resume a some what decent service is to reinstate the old timetable and take the pressure off key stations.

attributes.action: Make Philip Hammonds Brexit Preperation Fund the NHS Fund instead.
attributes.background:
Philip Hammond said in his Autumn 2017 Budget: 
“We have already invested almost £700 million in Brexit preparations, today I am setting aside over the next two years another £3 billion. And I stand ready to allocate further sums if and when needed”.

Let’s Fund our NHS Instead!

attributes.action: Safe staffing for pharmacy workers and patients.
attributes.background: I have personally worked within the pharmacy industry for over 10 years. During this time the NHS has suffered serious crises and GPs are under enormous pressure. In order to try and combat the extra pressure, more and more services are being passed onto pharmacists and other staff.
attributes.additional_details:
We need new laws on safe staffing. 

Despite the increase in services being brought into the pharmacies, staffing levels are at an all-time low. Often pharmacies are being left to run on just a pharmacist and one member of staff. This can lead to dispensing errors and put patients are risk. At the moment the pharmacists and staff can still be liable for prosecution when an error is made. The law should be changed to have safe staffing levels of at least two workers to safeguard workers and protect patients.

attributes.action: Fund a permanent memorial to soldiers killed in Northern Ireland
attributes.background:
On the 5th April 1979 Trooper Anthony Dykes along with Trooper Anthony Thornett of the Blues & Royals were killed in action whilst serving their country.

763 people gave the ultimate sacrifice in Northern Ireland whilst serving their country yet there is no permanent memorial to this.
attributes.additional_details:
My Grandparents are now in the later years of their life and have fought tirelessly for this to happen,they did a piece for ITV which I include a link below to:
http://www.itv.com/news/calendar/2017-03-27/couple-campaign-for-memorial-to-soldiers-killed-in-northern-ireland/

We owe it to those who gave their lives for their country to be honoured, I never had the chance to meet my Uncle but I am immensely proud of him for the sacrifice he gave to our country.
